summary: Endoscopy is a medical procedure that lets doctors see inside your body. They use a special tool called an endoscope, which is like a tiny camera with a light. It's inserted into your body to look at organs like your stomach or intestines. This helps doctors find any problems or diseases. There are different types of endoscopies, and sometimes you might need medicine to help you relax during the procedure. It's commonly used to check your digestive system.
title: Endoscopy
